endpoints.name: Gets the Permissions for a User
endpoints.description: Permissions determine if an individual user can read, edit, delete, or create records of a given object type.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Pipelines
endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns a list of pipelines that have been set up for the Insightly instance. Pipelines can be defined for both projects and opportunities, and are used to track the progression of projects and opportunities.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a Pipeline
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the graph for a specific pipeline.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Pipeline Stages
endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns a list of the pipeline stages that have been set up for the Insightly instance. Pipeline stages are used to indicate where a project or opportunity is in terms of its progression. For example, stage 1 for the sales pipeline might be 'initial contact', while stage 4 might be 'generating quote'. The API for pipeline stages is read only, so to create or update pipeline stages, you'll need to use the web app to do so.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a Pipeline Stage
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns the graph for a specific pipeline stage.

endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns a list of the project categories that have been configured for the Insightly instance.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Relationships
endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns a list of the relationships that have been defined for the Insightly instance. Relationships enable users to define how one Insightly object is related to another.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Tags used for a record type
endpoints.description: This endpoint returns a list of tags associated with a record type. The endpoint expects the query parameter record_type=contacts|leads|opportunities|organisations|projects|emails, so to fetch a list of tags associated with contacts, your query would be /Tags?record_type=contacts

queryParameters.name: record_type
queryParameters.description: Required, filters tags by a given record type.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns a list of the task categories set up for the Insightly instance.

queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Teams
endpoints.description: Simple object graphs (excluding TEAMMEMBERS) are returned if 'brief=true' is used in the query string.The API responses may contain two types of Teams: a) regular Teams configured via System Settings and b) so called Anonymous Teams which are created by the system when you set a record permission visible to Individuals. You can differentiate these two types on Teams by the ANONYMOUS_TEAM property. Anonymous Teams are a bit more restricted when it comes to modifying them via the API, they can only be created/updated/deleted via the root /Teams endpoint.

queryParameters.name: brief
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if response should only contain top level properties of the opportunity.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a Team
endpoints.description: Retrieves a single team based on ID.

endpoints.name: Gets the User object for the calling user
endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns the details for the currently authenticated user on an Insightly instance, same fields as returned by the /Users endpoint, but only for a single identified user.

endpoints.name: Gets a filtered list of Users
endpoints.description: This is a read only endpoint that returns a list of users associated with an Insightly instance. Use this endpoint when you need to obtain a list of valid USER_IDs, for example, when you want to assign a task to a specific user (do not confuse the USER_ID with their CONTACT_ID). Only one optional parameter (excluding top, skip and count_total) can be specified.

queryParameters.name: first_name
queryParameters.description: Optional, first name.

queryParameters.name: last_name
queryParameters.description: Optional, last name.

queryParameters.name: email
queryParameters.description: Optional, user's email address.

queryParameters.name: updated_after_utc
queryParameters.description: Optional, earliest date when team was last updated.

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a list of Users
endpoints.description: This is a read only endpoint that returns a list of users associated with an Insightly instance

queryParameters.name: count_total
queryParameters.description: Optional, true if total number of records should be returned in the response headers.

endpoints.name: Gets a User
endpoints.description: This read only endpoint returns the details for a specific user on an Insightly instance, same fields as returned by the /Users endpoint, but only for a single identified user.

operations.name: Adds a Contact
operations.description: If you have trouble with creating a contact, try creating contacts via the web interface, and then access those contacts via the API. This way you can see examples of the fields and sub-elements attached to the object. A common source of problems during write/update request is caused when users omit required fields, or insert invalid data in a field (e.g. reference a CATEGORY_ID that does not exist in the user's Insightly instance.

operations.name: Adds an Organisation
operations.description: If you have trouble with creating an organisation, try creating organisations via the web interface, and then access those organisations via the API. This way you can see examples of the fields and sub-elements attached to the object. A common source of problems during write/update request is caused when users omit required fields, or insert invalid data in a field (e.g. reference a CATEGORY_ID that does not exist in the user's Insightly instance.

operations.name: Updates an Organisation
operations.description: If you have trouble updating an organisation, try accessing the organisation via the GET request to inspect its fields and sub-elements. A common source of problems with write/update requests occurs when users either omit required fields, or insert invalid data into a field (for example, by referring a CATEGORY_ID or LINK_ID which does not exist.

sampleData.PROJECT_NAME: Whirlybird G950 - Sirius Corp. - Tina Martin

operations.name: Adds a Project
operations.description: A common source of problems when creating projects occurs when users omit required fields, or insert invalid data into a field (for example by referencing an invalid CATEGORY_ID). A good troubleshooting technique is to create a few projects via the web interface, with representative data, links, etc, and then access these projects via the API, and inspect the returned object graph. Also, note: The STAGE_ID and PIPELINE_ID properties of projects are read-only. (There are separate endpoints to update pipelines/stages.)

operations.name: Updates a Project
operations.description: A common source of problems when updating projects occurs when users omit required fields, or insert invalid data into a field (for example by referencing an invalid CATEGORY_ID). A good troubleshooting technique is to create a few projects via the web interface, with representative data, links, etc, and then access these projects via the API, and inspect the returned object graph. Also, note: The STAGE_ID and PIPELINE_ID properties of projects are read-only. (There are separate endpoints to update pipelines/stages.)
